pli-tv-bu-vb-sk40:2.1: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk40:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk40:6.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were making elongated mouthfuls. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk40:7.2: “‘I will make rounded mouthfuls,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk40:8.2: If a monk out of disrespect makes an elongated mouthful, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk40:9.6: if it is a non-staple food;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk40:9.7: if it is any kind of fruit;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk40:9.8: if it is a non-bean curry;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk40:9.11: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk40:10.1: The tenth training rule is finished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk40:10.2: The fourth chapter on respectfully is finished.
